name: Networked Suffering
desc: Infect up to 4 (+2 per stack) enemies with a computer virus that duplicates 45% of all damage taken and sends it to a global damage pool. Every 3 seconds, ALL infected enemies suffer 100% pooled damage .
notes:
Networked Suffering is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Alloyed Collective expansion.
When the user damages the first 4 (+2 per stack) enemies, it infects them with a computer virus. 45% of all damage done to infected enemies are added to a global damage pool, and every 3 seconds, all infected enemies take 100% of the damage in the global damage pool. The damage pool is then reset to 0.
The computer virus counts as a debuff.


== Notes ==
ALL get added multiplied and sent to the pool including: Teammates, Minions & damage with 0 proc coeff like damage over time effects.
Infected enemies glow a green colour, and a green line will be drawn from the player to the infected enemies.
 Noxious Thorn can spread the debuff, however it will not remember who owns the debuff.
As such monsters will not drop gold or activate on kills, but also not count towards the debuff application limit.
This was confirmed to not be a bug.
Looking at an infected enemy will show a green number next to their health, representing the current damage in the global damage pool.
When this number starts flashing red, it means that the current number in the damage pool is about to damage all infected enemies.
The debuff lasts indefinitely on enemies, meaning that once the user has reached the maximum number of enemies infected, they cannot infect other enemies unless they gain another stack of the item, or one of the infected enemies dies.
The damage from the pooled damage does not have a proc coefficient, meaning it will not trigger items such as  Tri-Tip Dagger or  AtG Missile Mk. 1.
The damage does not trigger critical strikes.
The computer virus requires a damage source with a proc coefficient higher than 0 in order to infect enemies.
This means that damage sources like  Brilliant Behemoth's explosion,  Kjaro's Band's fire tornado and   Captain's   Orbital Supply Beacon's impact do not infect uninfected enemies.
There is no distance limit for the debuff.
The debuff is applied permanently, meaning you will have to kill infected enemies to regain stock.
This can be a huge problem if monsters obtain this item, such as when   the Final Boss steals your items, as you will remain infected until your death or next stage.
As it is a permament debuff, it cannot be cleansed with a  Blast Shower or  Orphaned Core.


== Tips ==
Since the computer virus is a debuff, it counts towards  Death Mark, making the debuff easier to get.
The item synergizes very well with Area of Effect (AOE) items, helping both to kill the infected enemies faster and to spread the virus.
Any item or skill that deals damage and has a proc coefficient greater than 0 will spread the virus, with respect to the item's current infected enemies limit. The following are examples of items that can spread the virus:
 Bundle of Fireworks
 Will-o'-the-wisp's explosion
 Ukulele's chain lightning
 AtG Missile Mk. 1's missiles, and by extension  Plasma Shrimp
 Noxious Thorn
 Faraday Spur's explosion
 Sentient Meat Hook's hooks
 Runic Lens' meteor
 Remote Caffeinator's impact
Although the item synergizes well with AOE items, it still proves helpful with single-target damage, as it effectively does a burst of 45% of the damage you've done over the 3 second duration.
